title: Clickjacking in love.uber.com
vulnerability_information:
Hi , 


Your domain love.uber.com is vulnerable to Clickjacking.

I'm able to load the domain love.uber.com in an iframe , 
so an attacker can certainly take advantage of this clickjacking bug in love.uber.com

Click-jacking is a process of “stealing” clicks on your site, redirecting them to other places,  by putting your page in an iframe and placing the attacker’s content over yours. The idea is to make this look as seamless as possible, so the user can’t tell right away that something is wrong.

if someone frames your site and puts login controls directly over yours, then even tools like SiteKey , won’t prevent them from collecting username and password data.

POC Screenshot Attached !
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi ,

Your domain love.uber.com is vulnerable to Clickjacking.

I'm able to load the domain love.uber.com in an iframe ,
so an attacker can certainly take advantage of this clickjacking bug in love.uber.com

Click-jacking is a process of “stealing” clicks on your site, redirecting them to other places, by putting your page in an iframe and placing the attacker’s content over yours. The idea is to make this look as seamless as possible, so the user can’t tell right away that something is wrong.

if someone frames your site and puts login controls directly over yours, then even tools like SiteKey , won’t prevent them from collecting username and password data.

POC Screenshot Attached !

activities.message:
Thanks for your report.

Lack of X-Frame-Options being set is not, in itself, a vulnerability. To show a clickjacking attack, you'd need to illustrate that an attacker could clickjack a user into articulating some button which would be dangerous to the user. On this site, it doesn't even appear that you can login. If we're missing something here, please reply with an exact description about what iframe-able option a user might click in a clickjacking attack here.

Thanks and we look forward to evaluating your report further.
activities.markdown_message:
Thanks for your report.

Lack of X-Frame-Options being set is not, in itself, a vulnerability. To show a clickjacking attack, you'd need to illustrate that an attacker could clickjack a user into articulating some button which would be dangerous to the user. On this site, it doesn't even appear that you can login. If we're missing something here, please reply with an exact description about what iframe-able option a user might click in a clickjacking attack here.

Thanks and we look forward to evaluating your report further.

activities.message:
Thank you for your report. The lack of X-Frame-Options does not always indicate that a security vulnerability is present. This is an optional header that is only necessary on endpoints where there UI is rendered to invoke state changing actions. We recommend reading this informative post by David Ross: https://plus.google.com/u/0/+DavidRossX/posts/jVrtTRd5yKP

In the case of love.uber.com, there does not appear to be any state changing actions that can be done on this site.
 
Thanks,
-mike

activities.message:
Yes , you're right ! @mike-bugtriage @bugtriage-rob 
But sometime's clickjacking issues are combined with phishing attacks , simply allowing a legitimate domain for iframing is not the best idea , because this way a good legitimate looking phishing page can be crafted for user.
Anyways , i think it might be an acceptable risk for an organization.
I just reported this since I saw that uber resolved some issues earlier related to this domain .
